definition: to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: Tom howled  the news that some masked men held up a bank.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆喊叫着說，有幾個蒙面人搶劫了銀行。

sentences.english: He could not restrain himself from shouting aloud.
sentences.chinese: 他剋制不住自己要大聲喊叫。

sentences.english: They noticed a crowd of people shouting and cheering.
sentences.chinese: 他們看到一大羣人在喊叫歡呼。

sentences.english: Our headmaster was near us and he was shouting too.
sentences.chinese: 我們校長就在我們旁邊，他也在喊叫。

sentences.english: Listen to me. The P.A. is going to want to know why you didn’t scream.
sentences.chinese: 聽我說，檢察官會問你爲什麼不喊叫。

sentences.english: She springs up to the window again, screaming for help in vain.
sentences.chinese: 她再次衝到窗邊，徒勞地喊叫，尋求幫助。

sentences.english: Heather Ellis, who is an Africa American, says customers yelled racial slurs at her.
sentences.chinese: 她說，顧客向她喊叫了與種族有關的辱罵言語。

sentences.english: He ignored shouts begging him to stop and sign autographs.
sentences.chinese: 他絲毫不理會粉絲求他停下來簽名的喊叫聲。

sentences.english: The speaker was clamoured down by the audience.
sentences.chinese: 聽衆的喊叫迫使發言者終止了講話。

sentences.english: Pamela told me to sprinkle shouts, timely rain.
sentences.chinese: 向我灑來甘美的喊叫，及時雨。

sentences.english: Other drivers who had stopped their cars began yelling too.
sentences.chinese: 其他的司機停了車也開始喊叫。

sentences.english: Those who did not run or jump shouted at the top of their voice.
sentences.chinese: 那些沒跑步或者調高的用最大的聲音喊叫。

sentences.english: Sometimes parents scream, yell, and use putdowns.
sentences.chinese: 有時父母會尖叫，喊叫，和貶低。

sentences.english: Patty couldn’t remember why she hadn’t screamed.
sentences.chinese: 帕蒂記不起來自己爲什麼沒有喊叫。

sentences.english: He cupped his hands around his mouth and called.
sentences.chinese: 他將手掌在嘴邊彎成杯形喊叫。

sentences.english: Yes, some people will shriek about “debasing” the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，有些人會發出“貶低”美元的喊叫。

definition: shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
